Can anyone explain why the use of a TyKind is discouraged?

error: usage of `ty::TyKind`
  --> compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/debuginfo/type_names.rs:37:38
   |
37 |     type_name_cache: &mut FxHashMap<(TyKind<'tcx>, bool), Rc<str>>,
   |                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `-D rustc::usage-of-ty-tykind` implied by `-D warnings`
   = help: try using `Ty` instead
I think because Ty is smaller as it is only a single reference.
